questions.question_text: Which statements describe benefits of Snowflake's separation of compute and storage? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
AE correct

choices.D: Storage volume growth and compute usage growth can be tightly coupled.
choices.B: The separation ensures consistent data encryption across all virtual data warehouses.
choices.A: The separation allows independent scaling of computing resources.
choices.E: Compute can be scaled up or down without the requirement to add more storage.
choices.C: The separation supports automatic conversion of semi-structured data into structured data for advanced data analysis.

questions.question_text: True or False: A Snowflake account is charged for data stored in both Internal and External Stages.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The external stage is not part of Snowflake, so Snowflake does not store or manage the stage
Snowflake doesn't charge for both,B.False

For an external stage, cloud provider charge you bill but for internal stage snowflake will Charge. 
Since question asked for both then ans is false, snowflake doesn't charge for both

Selected Answer: A
Snowflake supports both internal stages and external stages.

Data files staged in Snowflake internal stages are not subject to the additional costs associated with Time Travel and Fail-safe, but they do incur standard data storage costs. 
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/tables-storage-considerations

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
